candidates.title: [chore]: Upgrade Rust version and remove surf client
candidates.body:
## About the changes
Upgrade Rust version (MSRV) to 1.74 and edition 2021, from https://lib.rs/stats#rustc, this is inline with ~99.1% of crates. And removed unmaintained surf client crate and it's related features.

- MSRV version is now 1.74
- Remove surf client
- Fix suggested clippy hints

#100 depends on this

candidates.title: feat: client identification headers
candidates.body:
<!-- Thanks for creating a PR! To make it easier for reviewers and everyone else to understand what your changes relate to, please add some relevant content to the headings below. Feel free to ignore or delete sections that you don't think are relevant. Thank you! ❤️ -->

## About the changes

This PR adds standardised client identification headers to the feature and metrics calls that the client makes to Unleash. The headers are:
- `unleash-appname`: the name of the application that is using the client. 
- `unleash-connection-id`: a unique identifier for the current instance of the client generated by the built-in UUID lib
- `unleash-sdk`: sdk information in the format `unleash-client-rust:<version>`

All the headers are intended for the Unleash team so clients should not be affected.
The main use cases we have are:
* capacity planning by knowing the number of unique connections made to the backend API
* debugging misconfigured SDKs sending more traffic than expected

### Important files
<!-- PRs can contain a lot of changes, but not all changes are equally important. Where should a reviewer start looking to get an overview of the changes? Are any files particularly important?  -->


## Discussion points
<!-- Anything about the PR you'd like to discuss before it gets merged? Got any questions or doubts? -->
I added 2 new dependencies deliberately choosing versions that work on 1.60.0. However some transitive dependencies of existing dependencies have changed and require 1.63.0. I found that any dependency update will trigger this error. I updated MSRV check in Github Actions.

Also we have a new way of adding library version at compile time from the Cargo file.

candidates.title: Update Crate info
candidates.body:
Hello, 

This updates the crate info so that the libs.rs page is up to date.

I'm not sure whether we need to update the Rust version to 1.79 to indicate that we support it

candidates.title: Update HTTP client support
candidates.body:
- make the default no-client at all, backwards
  incompatible but better overall I think.
- add reqwest 0.12 support

candidates.title: fix: under-counting metrics for enum is_enabled()
release: bump version to 0.10.2
candidates.body: Includes the fix for allowing trailing slashes in URLs.

candidates.title: Release: bump version to 0.10.0
candidates.body:
This bumps the version of the SDK to 0.10.0, releasing the recent [fix for variant distribution](https://github.com/Unleash/unleash-client-rust/pull/69).

Because this changes how the hashing works, it also changes some of the existing results. This requires a minor version update since we're pre-1.0.

candidates.title: Release: bump version to 0.9.0
candidates.body:
This bumps the version of the SDK to include the fix for feature descriptions added in #66.

Because the `Feature` struct is a `pub` struct, this becomes a breaking change, so I've bumped the minor version as we're before 1.0.

candidates.title: Release: bump version to 0.8.2
candidates.body: This is intended to release the fix for variant weighting that we recently introduced in e700231.

candidates.title: release: version 0.8.1
candidates.body: Release v0.8.1 with the new variant metrics functionality (#60 & #61)

candidates.title: Fix functional test for tokio
candidates.body: We merged a thoroughly broken refactoring of the functional test suite. That feature is not CI tested...

candidates.title: Strict parsing support
candidates.body: API parsing has been slack previously - unknown fields in API responses ignored. But for development turning that on is useful. This allows turning it on without code changes.

candidates.title: Support arbitrary HTTP clients
candidates.body:
Included: surf and reqwest.

Users can implement unleash_api_client::http::HttpClient to bring
support for their own preferred client.

This permits only pulling in the relevant async ecosystem for the client
being used, which may aide compile times for users of this crate.
